npcs.name: Marta the Innkeeper
npcs.description: A stout, middle-aged woman with graying hair and a warm smile. She knows everyone's business.

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to the Rusty Dragon! Sit, sit! You look like you could use a warm meal.
dialogue.farewell: Safe travels, friend. May the road rise to meet you.

topics.rumors: Well, they say there's been goblin activity on the old forest road. Travelers have gone missing...
topics.lodging: A room for the night? Five silver, includes breakfast. Best beds in town!
topics.town: Greenvalley's a quiet place, mostly farmers and craftsmen. We don't get much trouble... usually.

npcs.name: Torvin Ironforge
npcs.description: A muscular dwarf with a magnificent braided beard and burn scars on his forearms.

dialogue.greeting: Hmph. Another adventurer. What do ye need? Make it quick, I've orders to fill.
dialogue.farewell: Don't get yerself killed, eh? Bad for repeat business.

topics.weapons: Swords, axes, hammers - I make 'em all. Finest steel this side of the mountains.
topics.monsters: Fighting undead? Bludgeoning weapons. Skeletons hate 'em. Wolves? Fire does the trick.
topics.craft: A blade's not just metal, it's art. Takes years to learn, decades to master.

npcs.name: Elindra Starweaver
npcs.description: An elderly elf woman with silver hair and eyes that seem to see beyond the veil.

dialogue.greeting: Ah, young one. The threads of fate have brought you to my doorstep. Interesting.
dialogue.farewell: Remember: not all paths are visible to mortal eyes. Trust your instincts.

topics.magic: Magic is the language of creation itself. Learn to listen, and the universe speaks.
topics.undead: The walking dead are symptoms, not the disease. Seek the necromancer who commands them.
topics.prophecy: I have seen... fragments. Fire in the north. A blade reforged. A choice that echoes through time.

npcs.name: Captain Marcus Steele
npcs.description: A scarred human veteran with a commanding presence and tired eyes that have seen too much.

dialogue.greeting: State your business. I've got a town to protect and not enough guards to do it.
dialogue.farewell: Keep your nose clean and your blade ready. Dangerous times.

topics.bounties: Got a few open contracts. Goblins on the road, bandits in the hills, and something... worse in the old ruins.
topics.threats: Been quiet lately. Too quiet. The monsters are organized - that means something's commanding them.
topics.help: You want to help? Good. I'm stretched thin. Handle those goblins and there's coin in it for you.

npcs.name: Father Aldric
npcs.description: A kindly human cleric with gentle hands and a serene aura that puts the wounded at ease.

dialogue.greeting: Peace be upon you, traveler. The Light welcomes all who seek its warmth.
dialogue.farewell: Go with the Light's blessing. May it guide your path through darkness.

topics.healing: The body heals, given time and care. But wounds of the spirit - those require faith.
topics.undead: The undead are souls trapped between worlds. Some can be freed. Others... must be sent to rest.
topics.blessing: A blessing? Of course. May the Light shield you from harm and illuminate your way.

npcs.name: Shadow
npcs.description: A hooded figure whose face is never fully seen. Gender and race unknown.

dialogue.greeting: You shouldn't be talking to me. But since you are... what do you need?

topics.information: Information costs. Gold, favors, or secrets of your own. Nothing's free.
topics.underground: There's a whole network beneath this city. Thieves' guild, smugglers, worse. I know the way.
topics.secrets: Everyone has secrets. The mayor's gambling debts. The blacksmith's hidden past. Even you, I suspect.

npcs.name: Otto Greenfield
npcs.description: A weathered farmer with calloused hands and a worried expression.

dialogue.greeting: Travelers? Out here? Must be adventurer types. Mind the crops, will ya?
dialogue.farewell: Stay off the old road after dark. Trust me on that.

topics.problem: Something's been killing my livestock. Wolves, I thought, but the wounds... they ain't right.
topics.farm: Been farming this land forty years, like my father before me. Never seen times this bad.
topics.help: If you could look into those killings... I ain't got much, but I'd share what I have.

npcs.name: Lyra Songwind
npcs.description: A charismatic half-elf with a lute slung over her back and a mischievous twinkle in her eye.

dialogue.greeting: Well met, fellow travelers! You look like you have stories to tell - and I'm always listening.
dialogue.farewell: May your adventures make for songs worth singing!

topics.legends: Every land has its legends. The dragon beneath the mountain. The cursed sword. The lost kingdom...
topics.monsters: I've collected tales from a hundred taverns. Trolls fear fire. Vampires, sunlight. Mimics? Trust nothing.
topics.inspiration: Need courage? Let me play you a song of heroes who faced worse odds and triumphed!

shop_greeting: Ah, a customer! How can I help you today?
Browse freely, friend. Quality goods at fair prices.
quest_accept: Excellent. Here's what you need to know...
Good. I knew I could count on adventurers like you.
quest_decline: Hmm. A shame, but I won't force you.
Very well. The offer stands if you change your mind.
quest_complete: You did it! I can't thank you enough.
Remarkable! You've earned every coin of this reward.
The town owes you a great debt. Here, as promised.
combat_warning: Careful out there. The roads aren't safe.
You're going to fight those things? Brave souls.
If you see trouble, run first. Fight only if you must.
